result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Linda S. Morrill
Current: 2707 1/2 North 6th Street, Wausau, WI 54403 United States  (Effective: 11-24-2015)
Prior: 4311 Schofield Ave, Lot 42, Schofield, WI 54476 United States

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 8:13 am 
INCLUDES 15CF184, 15CM410, AND 14CM1156. 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty John Zich.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW. 
State notes information and prelim waiver has not been done in 15CF184. 
COURT notes no need for prelim in 15CF184 but advises State file information by close of business today. 

State moves to: 
In 15CF184: Ct. 2 (Misd BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
In 15CM410: Ct. 1 (Misd. BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 15CF184: Ct. 1 (Forgery-Uttering/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 14CM1156: Ct. 1 (Battery/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
                       : Ct. 2 (DC/Repeater/Use of Dangerous Weapon)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made,  a factual basis, def guilty in 14CM1156, and defers sentencing on Ct. 1 in 15CF184. 
Def makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: On both counts in 14CM1156>>SWH for 2 years probation - CONDITIONS: assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; no contact with R.B; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 10 hours of community service per week; payment of court costs. 
COURT finds the def is entitled to 37 days jail credit in 14CM1156 if revoked. 
State requests sentencing be set for a later date in 15CF184 as parties are anticipating a DEOJ but def must complete necessary assessments. 
COURT grants and sets calendar call on 7/22/2015 at 1pm with Br. 3 JA to set sentencing in 15CF184. 
Atty Zich requests reduce bond from cash to signature bond. 
COURT grants - converts cash bond to signature bond. 

Adj: 8:33 am
Motion hearing at 07-16-2015 08:00 am
